org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.phd

Interface PhdWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PhdBallWriter, SinglePhdWriter

    public interface PhdWriter
extends Closeable
    PhdWriter is an interface for writing Phds.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void write(Phd phd)
      Write the given Phd without version information.
      void write(Phd phd, Integer version)
      Write the given Phd with the given version number.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(Phd phd)
    throws IOException
        Write the given Phd without version information. This is the same as write(phd, null) All PhdWholeReadItems, comments and PhdReadTags for this Phd will also be written out. If the Phd does not contain any positions (Phd.getPeakSequence() returns null) then positions will not be written out.
        Parameters:
        phd - the phd to write, can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing this phd.
        NullPointerException - if phd is null.
        See Also:
        write(Phd, Integer)

      • write

        void write(Phd phd,
           Integer version)
    throws IOException
        Write the given Phd with the given version number. New versions of consed support the version number included along with the sequence name inside the phd file. Previously the version information was only available by the number suffix in the filename. All PhdWholeReadItems, comments and PhdReadTags for this Phd will also be written out. If the Phd does not contain any positions (Phd.getPeakSequence() returns null) then positions will not be written out.
        Parameters:
        phd - the phd to write, can not be null.
        version - the version of this phd; if this value is null, then no version is written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem writing this phd.
        NullPointerException - if phd is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if version is not null and version < 1.
